member.name: M:DBreeze.DataTypes.NestedTable.InsertDataBlock(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Insert a dynamic size data block in the table storage, returns fixed 16 bytes length identifier
which can be stored in a table value from specified index.
Retrieve such DataBlock we can using Row.GetDataBlock.
The same statement is used to update datablock, received value must update row value who holds reference to it.
Must be used as row column with dynamic length
member.param: if null creates new data block, if not null tries to overwrite existing data block
member.returns:
returns created data block parameters of fixed 16 bytes length, which can be stored in the row value
and later reused for getting data block back

member.name: M:DBreeze.DataTypes.NestedTable.InsertDictionary``3(``0,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{``1,``2},System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Inserts a dictionary into nested-table row.
Designed for simple dictionary data types.
Actually creates a new table inside of nested table row and handles it like dictionary.
If new Dictionary is supplied then non-existing keys in supplied DB will be removed from db
new values will be inserted, changed values will be updated
To get dictionary use SelectDictionary
member.param: if true, then values which are not in supplied dictionary will be removed from db, otherwise only appended and updated
member.returns: Returns Nested Table where insert was made

Actually creates a new table inside of nested table row and handles it like table with THashSetKey key any byte[] == null value.

member.name: F:DBreeze.DBreezeConfiguration.AlternativeTablesLocations
member.summary:
Pattern based way to specify storage and location for tables.
Key of this dictionary must contain table pattern e.g. Article$/Items# or Car456 or Items*
Value, if is String.Empty, means that table will be located in memory.
Value, if not empty, means physical storage folder path, where table should reside.
If table doesn't intersect any pattern then default DB configuration will be overriden for the storage.
If table intersects more the one pattern then first found will be applied.
Help for patterns:
$ * #
"U" symbol in the following examples means intersection
* - 1 or more of any symbol kind (every symbol after * will be cutted): Items* U Items123/Pictures
# - symbols (except slash) followed by slash and minimum another symbol: Items#/Picture U Items123/Picture
$ - 1 or more symbols except slash (every symbol after $ will be cutted): Items$ U Items123; Items$ !U Items123/Pictures

member.name: F:DBreeze.DBreezeConfiguration.RICommunicator

member.name: M:DBreeze.Transactions.Transaction.SynchronizeTables(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary:
Use before any table modification command inside of the transaction.
In case if transaction is going to modify only 1 table, reservation is not necessary, there is no danger of the deadlock.
Table Names available patterns:
$ * #
* - 1 or more of any symbol kind (every symbol after * will be cutted): Items* U Items123/Pictures
# - symbols (except slash) followed by slash and minimum another symbol: Items#/Picture U Items123/Picture
$ - 1 or more symbols except slash (every symbol after $ will be cutted): Items$ U Items123; Items$ !U Items123/Pictures
member.param: can be either tableName or pattern like Articles#/Items*

member.name: M:DBreeze.Transactions.Transaction.SynchronizeTables(System.String[])
member.summary:
Use before any table modification command inside of transaction
In case if transaction is going to modify only 1 table, reservation is not necessary, there is no danger of the deadlock.
Table Names available patterns:
$ * #
* - 1 or more of any symbol kind (every symbol after * will be cutted): Items* U Items123/Pictures
# - symbols (except slash) followed by slash and minimum another symbol: Items#/Picture U Items123/Picture
$ - 1 or more symbols except slash (every symbol after $ will be cutted): Items$ U Items123; Items$ !U Items123/Pictures

member.summary: IS USED BY NON-RANGE SELECTS OPERATORS Retuns LTrie (or later by necessity ITrie) and as out variable ReadRootNode which must be used for READ FUNC data acquiring. READ FUNCs calling this proc will receive table and as out var. root, this root will be supplied to the trie. If root is null, then write root will be used. If table is null - table doesn't exist.

member.name: F:DBreeze.Transactions.Transaction.ReadVisibilityScopeModifier_GenerateNewTableForRead
member.summary:
Will be used when getting new table for ReadVisibilityScope=true in this transaction. If true, will create new read-table, if false, will try to reuse cached (once created) existing read-table (or create new cached READ-TABLE).
Switch ReadVisibilityScopeModifier_GenerateNewTableForRead can be changed many times during transaction. May be switched to true, before call Select...,AsReadVisibilityScope = true, then can be switched back.

summary.para: When true, will show also updated, but not committed changes, to the moment of request.

member.name: M:DBreeze.Transactions.Transaction.TextInsert(System.String,System.Byte[],System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts/Updates searchable words per external documentID
member.param: Real DBreeze table name, used to store text index for the group of documents. Must be added to tran.SynchronizeTables by programmer.
External document id, it will be returned after executing TextSearch.block.GetDocumentIDs
Space separated words, which will be stored using "contains" logic.
Space separated words, which will be stored using "full-match" logic (they can be also search via contains words by StartsWith logic)

Means that document will be indexed in parallel thread and possibly search functionality for the document will be available a bit later after commit. It's good for the fast Commits while inserting relatively large searchables-set . Default value is false, means that searchables will be indexed together with Commit and will be available at the same time.
Minimal lenght of the word to be searched using "contains" logic. Default is 3.

External document id, it will be returned after executing TextSearch.block.GetDocumentIDs
Space separated words, which will be stored using "contains" logic.
Space separated words, which will be stored using "full-match" logic

Means that document will be indexed in parallel thread and possible search will be available a bit later after commit. A secondary hash function will be provided for you if your type T is either string or int. Otherwise an exception will be thrown. If you are not using these types please use the overload that supports custom hash functions.

If you are not using these types please use the overload that supports custom hash functions.

member.name: M:DBreeze.Utils.BytesProcessing.To_FixedSizeColumn(System.String,System.Int16,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Converts your text into byte[], which can be used as column of fixedSize+2.
(2 bytes are always added to your fixedSize value, determination of actual text size and NULL flag)
String can be null Will return byte[] with the length fixedSize+2 which can be stored as column.
If text.Length after convertion (using ASCII or UTF8) overexceeds fixedSize, text will be truncated
member.param: any string, can be NULL
reservation space(returned byte[] will be of fixedSize+2)
if true, text will be presented as ASCII, otherwise as UTF-8

member.name: M:DBreeze.Utils.BytesProcessing.From_FixedSizeColumn(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
takes byte[] created by To_FixedSizeColumn and restores string value from it.
byte[] must be of length fixedSize(which you gave in To_FixedSizeColumn) + 2
member.param: if true, text was presented as ASCII, otherwise as UTF-8

member.summary: Converts BytesArray to String Representation: 00-00-00-00-1F-00-00-00-00-20. If array is null or 0 length - returns String.Empty. If replaceWith is String.Empty returns such view 00-00-00-00-1F-00-00-00-00-20. Otherwise takes such view (-00-00-00-00-1F-00-00-00-00-20) and replaces "-" with replaceWith also calls Trim().
